reviews.text: Two years ago I stayed at the FourSeasons in Sharm and as we were on a smaller budget I selected this hotel as friends told me good things about the Melia chain and I loved the lighthouse of this hotel cause I saw it from the beach of the FourSeasons.
reviews.title: Melia Sinai

likes.liked: — the coral reef in front of the hotel, just amazing, one of the best divers sites!

reviews.text: We arrived quite early, around 1pm but got a room almost immedately. Room was very spacious and nicely furbished and even though I booked a twin room and this had a king bed, housekeeping quickly pulled the two beds away and in 5 mins we had our twin-bedded room!
reviews.title: Would not go again
Stay away
reviews.text: I really loved the fact that it is a relative small (190some rooms) hotel with a very big beach (which is rather unusual in sharm, check on google earth).

Service is somewhat slow, thats Egypt, Europeans better get used to it as it is rather on the normal side in the Arabic world and also on many islands in the Caribbean and in Oceania. They have time, do not rush...
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Throughout the stay we had only one major issue, the buffet dinner. Breakfast was rich and good, but dinner was rather poor, sometimes was really not easy to choose a food, if you dont like fish and other stuff you end up with chicken that was served for such people every day. But for a two weeks stay its a bit annoying, having chicken for every dinner. Luckily they also have a pasta corner with freshly made pastas (but my mom does not like pasta neither seafood, so for her it was chicken-chicken-chicken...)
reviews.title: God some people compain!!

reviews.text: We have just returned from our second stay at this hotel and it was just as good this year as it was last - we enjoyed ourselves again.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.text: The staff are the best ever - nothing is too much trouble for them and the food is very good - some may say that it is a bit 'samey' but this isn't a British hotel and one should go abroad willing to try what is on offer in a foreign country - not expect the same old British food.
reviews.title: excellent holiday

likes.disliked: — hard beds same eating place all holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean - there are people cleaning all the public places all the time and the bedrooms are serviced every day, with towels left in all sorts of 'sculptures' and flowers left.
reviews.title: Shouldnt be a 5 star rated hotel

likes.liked: — that it was in a sunny climate!

reviews.text: We took friends with us this year and they were as pleased as we were with the hotel and have decided they will definitely come with us again next year - we now just have to wait for the dates to be made available and we'll be booking.
reviews.title: Nice but missing those extra touches

reviews.text: One of the lovely things that happened was, on our first visit to the restaurant, one of the waiters who had served us last year saw us and came and greeted us like old friends and welcomed us back. How often does that happen?
reviews.title: Great hotel, watch out for the mozzies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We (Frank n Deb) have just arrived back (left Sharm 9.05am this morning) so I thought I'd write the review whilst the last 2 weeks are fresh in my mind.
reviews.title: The Good, Bad and the Ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good
reviews.title: Another fairly disappointed customer

likes.liked: — Very clean, peaceful area, great snorkelling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reef - Amazing. Snorkeling gear can be hired out, but the dive shop who are really professional do trial dives which we both did. Safety is paramount and they'll only go out one instructor one pupil. Cost is approximately £45pp and well worth every penny.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff - the staff are genuinely helpful and you do not get treated like cash points like other AI holidays we've been on. Do give a decent tip on the first day though to your barman, pool guy and the cleaners. You'll get a huge difference in service and it's well worth it. Ahmed - our pool barman was hilarious and he is so quirky but absolutely brilliant. After a couple of days, he knew to bring a large diet pepsi to me for the first drink. Sherife; our breakfast, lunch and evening waiter was equally brilliant and always seemed to find us a great table either inside or out.
reviews.title: Great Expectations

likes.liked: — The view from the lovely balcony

reviews.title: Great diving
reviews.text: Room - we stayed in room 5230 which was amazing. If you reserve this room before going out - do! It's on the third floor, two balconies with beautiful views.

After having a wonderful AI holiday in Sharm last year at the Concorde el Salam hotel (highly recommend), we decided on the Melia Sinai this year as it came so highly recommended on trip advisor for both hotel and diving. What a mistake! Compared to the Concorde this was a most disappointing 2 weeks. Be aware that if you go AI, then you are definitely treated as second class - particularly with food and drink. The other reasons are: poor quality equipment and furnishings of the hotel in general - bed like concrete, old worn, bobbly sheets (where is the top grade Egyptian cotten?!), no hot water for three days, air conditioning didn't ever work properly, drab furnishings - and that's just the room. The beds and parasols by the pool were in poor condition and very hard to put up. The bars were dull, and staff very slow (reluctant) to serve alcohol for AI customers, some ignoring us at the bar but serving paying customers quickly, fruit juices watered down, making it very frustrating. We got served beer from bottles already opened for other customers (one bottle doesn't fill a glass, but they won't give the rest of the bottle, they put the lid on and keep behind the bar, and then use it for the next drink ordered). We presumed like others there, that staff are encouraged to respond slowly to AI customers, to save them money. One of the most annoying things was lack of water - at the Concorde water was free and plentiful - but here you had to argue for every bottle (whilst non-AI customers had no problems). Waiters got cross if you asked to keep the bottle they had poured from at mealtimes, and you are only allowed one glass per person. Bizarre.
reviews.title: Disappointing hotel

likes.liked: — Uncomfortable bed, problems with air conditioning and hot water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was truly awful - not just boring and repetitive, it was unappetising, and limited. As a vegetarian, there is no choice at all (cheese only served at breakfast). Its the same everyday - meat in sauce, rice, salad, pasta. The pasta sauces were bland and watery. The buffet salads were out from 12.30 to 3pm and had nothing to stop flies landing on them - no wonder everyone we spoke to had a stomach upset at least once. If you wanted a change of food there was only one other choice, which you have to pay for - the Pergola bar, which served more appetising food (but why wasn't this available in the AI restaurant?). Snacks and icecreams were either very hard to locate (in different bars at odd times), or non-existent, and you were certainly not encouraged to enjoy the AI experience; the hotel's policy seemed to be actively aimed at giving you as little as possible. This was totally unlike our experience at the Concorde, where there was a choice of AI restaurants, a wide range of international foods, snacks, ice cream and drinks available all day, bars with different themes, comfortable places to relax, and much more comfortable accomodation.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but more like a 4* than a 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The plus side was the diving (snorkelling or scuba) is fantastic, but then it is at any of the hotels in this area.
reviews.title: Thank god I'm home!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff told us that they have only been doing AI for six months, so perhaps it will improve. However, it has a long way to go to do this, and at the moment, we would be hard pressed to give it a 3* rating, let alone 5*.
reviews.title: Don't Go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Paradise on Earth
